content.rendered:
Photo by Paul Jarvis found on Unsplash

This Week in Genesis (#35), beautiful new themes (from StudioPress, Appfinite and Heather Jones), beautiful websites in the showcase, and… StudioPress redesigns their website. ?

StudioPress redesign

Pretty hard not to start This Week in Genesis without mentioning the new, and beautiful, website redesign from the very people who are responsible for us all gathered here.

Thank you StudioPress and your team for continuing to inspire and lead the community in beautiful designs and of course… the Genesis framework.

Happy to announce we have a brand new look — https://t.co/mRvAvBkhn1 (props @laurenmancke on the design)

— StudioPress (@studiopress) January 25, 2016

With a preview from Lauren Mancke and congrats on her amazing work on the project.

Had a blast designing, developing, and photographing a new site for @studiopress: https://t.co/0jqgokGQlL

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) January 25, 2016

You can see their new design at studiopress.com.

Themes

Not only did StudioPress redesign their website, Brian decided to add another beautiful theme to the mix.

Introducing the Digital Pro theme — https://t.co/q4bfRMwXG5 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/JZJlc1xoK0

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) January 27, 2016

Check out the very clean, as to be expected with our favourite minimalist friend, and elegant Digital Pro theme on StudioPress.

Our friends at appfinite added another stunning theme to their shop called Vintage.

Check out our latest “Vintage” theme for the Genesis Framework – https://t.co/Ikpha1NGHc #wordpress #genesiswp

— appfinite (@appfinite) January 28, 2016

Check out the Vintage demo here.  I’m sure you’ll be using this for your next project. 😉

Heather Jones, launches the beautifully put together Cuisine theme.

So thrilled to launch the Cuisine theme today. Take a look! https://t.co/IdQ6rD9Hz5 #wordpress #genesiswp #blogging pic.twitter.com/pKBS6AVsmF

— Heather Jones (@vivalaviolette) January 22, 2016

Showcase

Not only did she just redesign StudioPress.com, Lauren Mancke is clearly on a roll because her personal site is also sporting a great new design too.

Tinkering with a new site design at https://t.co/nau72fN1S9 #genesiswp / posted on @dribbble https://t.co/4UOfF2aq1U pic.twitter.com/m0Fmh8XKp6

— Lauren Mancke (@laurenmancke) January 27, 2016

…Heather Jones is back with an update of her own site, vivalaviolette.com

Viva la Violette got a fresh little update! Check it out https://t.co/L9ch2z0mpa #webdesign #wordpress #genesiswp #wordpressthemes

— Heather Jones (@vivalaviolette) January 25, 2016

…Joe Law with a new site for alyeskafamilymedicine.com (h/t Bradley Potter)

We're excited to announce the awesomely updated, new and improved mobile-friendly website for https://t.co/3UhYsvT0Iq! Congratulations!

— Joe Law – Founder (@sundogmedia) January 26, 2016

…Tony Eppright with a new site for peacetreemassagecarmel.com

Our latest #genesiswp custom responsive website is officially live https://t.co/NC5ESDonc2 #wordpress pic.twitter.com/hqxi6gYcwz

— Tony Eppright (@_AlphaBlossom) January 24, 2016

Podcasts & Interviews

Upcoming interview with Mr Frank Schrijvers of @wpstudiowp, right here on GenesisWP.guide on Monday.

Got a great interview with (and giveaway from) Mr Frank Schrijvers of @wpstudiowp going out on Monday, stay tuned! pic.twitter.com/DSbOVM1vN9

— GenesisWPguide (@GenesisWPguide) January 28, 2016

And the Office Hours Podcast with Carrie Dils talking to Curtis McHale about proposals… which we all love. 😉

In case you missed it, I had a fantastic chat today with @curtismchale about writing proposals. Catch the replay! https://t.co/PmZ7RaUBSy

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) January 29, 2016

And the UK Genesis Podcast is back with Elizabeth Jamieson in the hot seat this week.

We're live with @lizzydiy! https://t.co/P1lEBfGRh3 #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/Cy9HfYGXyO

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) January 27, 2016

Best of the rest

And speaking of proposals, Troy Dean is giving away is WordPress Proposal Blueprint and US$1,000 cash!!

Attention #WordPress Consultants: I’m giving away my WordPress Proposal Blueprint and US$1,000 cash. https://t.co/BgzUWqWR7x

— Troy Dean (@troydean) January 21, 2016

And the very talented Carrie Dils would like all of us to go back and learn how to create a Genesis child theme from scratch.  Just because…

Interested in learning how to build a Genesis child theme from scratch? @cdils takes us to school. https://t.co/kwsEaiSs16 #genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) January 28, 2016

Lindsey Riel is answering your your #WordPress, #genesiswp and #business questions on her blog : http://bit.ly/1OZPUGn

I’m answering your #WordPress, #genesiswp and #business questions on the blog today: https://t.co/EtsVp7FRAy

— Lindsey Riel (@lindseyriel) January 28, 2016

…and Calvin Koepke is starting a newsletter for web designers.

Did you know I’m starting a newsletter for web designers? Learn more here — https://t.co/LaC5yCnLnN #wordpress #genesiswp

— Calvin Koepke (@cjkoepke) January 26, 2016

Mike Hemburger also wrote a small plugin to help with custom post archive settings in Genesis.

Wrote a small, but useful plugin for the #genesiswp community. Helps if you work with a lot of custom post types. https://t.co/EmbcPm0F8v

— Mike Hemberger (@JiveDig) January 27, 2016

The Dear theme by Shay Bocks has had a name change (check out the article for the interesting reasons behind that).

A little name change and a permission slip to pivot. https://t.co/7hLgMh3Hmk #genesiswp #foodblogger #blogging

— Shay Bocks (@shaybocks) January 29, 2016

Definitely feeling the love this week. So great to be part of a community that gives so much back.

PS Don’t forget about these Facebook groups you can join. The Genesis WordPress Community and the Genesis Showcase group… we want to see what you’re working on!!

PPS Next week look out for another new guest editor, Sandee Jackson who’ll be giving us her take!

excerpt.rendered: Beautiful new themes (from StudioPress, Appfinite and Heather Jones), beautiful websites in the showcase, and… StudioPress redesigns their website.
